notesStmt.note: Imperfect at the beginning and at the end.

Shelomoh ben Avraham Norzi: inscribed, folio 1r. Re'uven ben David mi-Perushah [?]: inscribed, folio 3r.Censored by Giovanni Domenico Carretto, Italian censor (active in the first quarter of the 17th century): inscribed with his name, 1618 (folio 175r ); see 100-101.Censored by Dominico Irosolomitano, Italian censor (active in the last quarter of the 16th and first quarter of the 17th century): inscribed with his name (folio 175v); see 61. Censored by Alessandro Scipione, Italian censor: inscribed with his name, 1597, Mantua (folio 175v).
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: The commentary of Hananel ben Ḥushiʼel on parts of Seder neziḳin.

msItem.title: פירוש סדר נזיקין Perush Seder neziḳin

collation.p: Originally quires of 12 leaves each. Presently incomplete. Catchwords at the end of the quires (presently visible on folio 12v, 24v, 36v, 76v).

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Ashkenazi semi-cursive script of the 15th century.

binding.p: BM/BL in-house. Spine title: 'Chananel. Comm. on Baba Kamma. Etc. Hebrew. Brit. Mus. Additional 27, 194.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: Giuseppe Almanzi (b. 1801, d. 1860), bibliophile; his manuscript no. 308; his library including 322 medieval Hebrew manuscripts were purchased en bloc by the British Museum in October 1865 for £1,000 through Asher & Co., Berlin dealer to the British Museum (see 131-153): inscribed, folio [178v].
